CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1941, pg. 6, reads: "Last Minute Rush for Courier Cooking School Tickets in on...Don't Wait...Get Yours Now! - The grand rush for tickets for The Courier Cooking School is on. Merchants are being swamped with requests.  Pictures above show some of the people purchasing the valuable ducats.  The school opens Thursday and continues through Saturday at the spacious Hill City Auditorium....A customer at Dearing's Tea Room, 2524 Wylie, gets her tickets from Mrs. Dearing, well known proprietor of the popular eatery..."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. Dearing handing Pittsburgh Courier's Cooking School tickets to woman wearing coat with fur collar, in Dearing's Tea Room
